page.title: 07NEW HALL FARM BOREHAM
page.content: On the New Hall estate there is a farm that is leased. The farmer manages the farm with the help of his semi-retired father, additional labour is hired when necessary. 30 acres are leased to the New Hall Riding School. Grass is grown on 15 acres,and this is cut for hay, much of which is sold to the riding school. The remainder is devoted to crops. This year Winter Wheat was grown on 30 acres Winter Barley on 11 and Summer Barley on 14. Until recently a dairy herd was kept, and New Hall was supplied with milk. Now calves are bought in at 1 week old to rear for beef. They are sold at 12 to 15 months. The buyer finishes rearing them on grass. Machinery includes 3 tractors, 3 trailers, 3 corn-drills and a combine harvester.
